title: 5 unconventional trends we already can't wait to try from AFI Fashion Week
text:
A peak into fashion week trends.

Africa Fashion International (AFI) Fashion Week day one is done, and as we look forward to the next two days, these are the hot accessories and beauty trends we’ve spotted so far.

The corset

Designer Eric Raisina from Madagascar shows a textured corset. As the corset aesthetics is on the trends list, this is a piece that you could add to your look. The designer added a bright knit belt to add to the statement piece.

Extended lashes

The feathered beauty look has once again hit the runway, as seen before on the Valentino Spring/Summer 2019 runway. David Tlale created his own look with black feathers on the models who walked the runway.

READ MORE: Face jewellery as seen at NYFW - Is this the next bizarre trend we're all going to get in on?

David Tlale model at AFI fashion week in Johannesburg:

Valentino Haute Couture Spring/Summer '19 show by designer Pier paolo Piccioli.

Statement handbags

Under the theme African Fashion Unite, these guests accessorised with a statement handbag. Handbags have become more elaborate with interesting textures, shapes and colours – and a boombox-shaped handheld bag is right on trend.

READ MORE: Inclusive model casting, GBV awareness, and the Mantsho by Palesa Mokubung collection make big news at Free State Fashion Week

Offbeat accessories

Speaking on statement accessories, designer Marianne Fassler had her models walk down the runway with ornamental cattle head necklaces around their necks.

READ MORE: From Cardi B's fully covered look to memorable model walks - these are the top quirks that came out of this fashion month

Floral headpieces

A trend spotted on the runway that will help as summer hits us is the flora as hair accessories.
